description.narrative: For GGF funds will contribute to Fundacion Melimoyu's work in establishing the Tictoc Marine Park and Pitipalena Anihue Marine Protected Area. Both are located in the fjord district of Southern Chile with a combined area of 100,000 acres. These will be the first two coastal protected areas in the whole Chlioe Eco region, which comprises more than 600km of coastline, roughly 1/3 of Patagonia's Pacific Ocean seaboard. This region accounts for 90 percent of Chile's salmon farming, 65 percent of the shellfish harvest, and 30 percent of the commercial fishing production. Local fisherfolk organizations, neghiborhood associations and local tourism guilds support the efforts in order to protect their livelihoods. Currently this ecosystem is devoid of official protection and is seeing influx of threats. Fundacion Melimoyu will continue their efforts working with government officials toward the signing of a legal decree for the two areas by showing the local organizational support for the projects.
